businessmath.api

Class Rent

  • java.lang.Object
    • businessmath.api.Rent

  • public final class Rent
extends java.lang.Object
    Static Final class that computes values in problems of Rents (Annuities) and Money Series

      Rent()

    • Method Detail

      • fv

        public static double fv(double pmt,
        double rate,
        double nper,
        int type)
        Computes Future Value - (FV) of a Rent (Annuity) that is either Ordinary or Annuity Due. The annuity does not have an initial deposit.
        Parameters:
        pmt - - Payment, The amount of money in each time period
        rate - - Rate of the Rent as a decimal number
        nper - - Number of Time Periods as a decimal
        type - - Defines if the rent is Ordinary (0) or Annuity Due (1)
        Returns:
        fv - The Future Value of the rent

      • pv

        public static double pv(double pmt,
        double rate,
        double nper,
        int type)
        Computes Present Value - (PV) of a Rent (Annuity) that is either Ordinary or Annuity Due. The annuity does not have an initial deposit.
        Parameters:
        pmt - - Payment, the amount of money in each time period
        rate - - Rate of the rent as a decimal number
        nper - - Number of Time Periods as a decimal
        type - - Defines if the rent is Ordinary (0) or Due (1)
        Returns:
        pv - The Present Value of this rent

      • numberOfPeriods

        public static double numberOfPeriods(double pmt,
                     double pv,
                     double rate,
                     int type)
        Computes the Number of Periods (nper) of the Rent (Annuity) given the Pmt, Pv and Rate arguments.
        Parameters:
        pv - - Present Value of this investment
        pmt - - Payment, the amount of money in each time period
        rate - - Rate as a decimal number
        type - - Defines if the rent is Ordinary (0) or Due (1)
        Returns:
        numberOfPeriods - The Number of Time Periods (nper) as a decimal number

      • pmt

        public static double pmt(double pv,
         double nper,
         double rate,
         int type)
        Computes the Payment (PMT) of the rent for paying back the initial deposit Pv given also the rate and nper arguments.
        Parameters:
        pv - - Present Value - The current amount of money in this investment, typically a loan
        rate - - Rate of investment or loan as a decimal number
        type - - Defines if the rent is Ordinary (0) or Due (1)
        nper - - Number of Time Periods as a decimal
        Returns:
        pmt - The payment for each time period
